intro: Oenothera hartwegii subsp. hartwegii, commonly known as the Hartweg's evening primrose, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It is characterized by its showy, yellow-orange flowers that bloom in the evening, attracting nocturnal pollinators such as moths. The plant produces capsule fruits that contain numerous small, oval seeds. It thrives in well-drained sandy or rocky soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid environments. Oenothera hartwegii subsp. hartwegii is a perennial herb with a taproot system and hairy stems and leaves.
